Dang Cat. Rowan's cat was being very energetic one day. Rowan was attempting to do some yard work anyway. The cat kept trying to go outside every time Rowan exited. Rowan had the front lawn all dug up and muddy. The cat managed to escape paws first right into the mud.
Target. Addison loves to go to Target. She spends a lot of money there. She decided to make a Target budget. Now she goes to Target with a list. She has a lot more money now!

The Eater. The man ate the same meals every day for breakfast lunch and dinner. He was at his favorite restaurant eating his same waffles and sausage. He looked out the window and saw a young girl eating alone. The man walked up to the girl and asked to eat together. She ordered the same meal as him and he fell head over heels in love.

Walk. I lost control last night. And I ate so much food that I couldn't walk. The next day, I wasn't even hungry. And I decided to walk for 4 hours to make up for what I ate before. But I only felt a small improvement.
Performing a concert. Alex had a holiday concert. He was playing the violin in it. He got dressed in his uniform. Then, he went to the auditorium. There, he performed for two hours.

Janitor Job. I had a degree in art history. I couldn't find a job for months. Eventually, I applied for a janitor position. I got an interview! Alas, they didn't give me an offer because I was overqualified.
Jack's Dog. Jack saw a dog in the street. He didn't want the dog to get hit by a car! Jack took the dog to his house. Jack and the dog really took to each other. Now Jack has a new dog!

Cleaning the yard. Sharon wanted to clean her yard up. First she had to clean up all of the trash. Next, she pulled all of the weeds. The last thing she did was trim the hedges. When the yard was clean, she relaxed in a chair.
He will pay. Guillermo was a recurring thief. He was growing more desperate. So he assailed a woman for her purse. The woman however, called the police. And Guillermo was apprehended.
Swing Time. Brie ran to the playground with joy in her heart. She was going to swing all day. Suddenly she stopped. The swings were all gone. Brie was upset the rest of the day.

Jeff's A Lost Cause. Jeff had a wife named Susan whom he loved deeply. She passed away from breast cancer last year. He hasn't coped well and started drinking. He lost his job because he was drinking on the job. Now all he does is sit at home all day and drink.

Old diary. Maggie was cleaning her attic that afternoon. She opened an old box to peer inside. She found an old diary that belonged to her grandmother. Maggie decided to drive to her grandma to give it to her. Her grandmother was so touched, she cried of joy at the souvenir.

Christmas lights. It was getting close to winter. The Barnes family decided it was time to hang Christmas lights. They picked out a set from the store. They hung them on the side of the house. When they plugged them in, only half lighted up.
The Appointment. Mary was running to catch the bus. She was late for an appointment. She tripped and fell. The bus left without her. A friend of Mary's drove her to her appointment.

Pajamas. I went to the store to buy some pajamas. Always a kid at heart, I looked for ones with feet. I found some with betty boop all over them. I then found some with mickey mouse. I took them both home to wear.

The warning. My brother in law drinks too much and drives a block to get beer. I went to the store yesterday and the girl pulled me aside. She let me know he is driving to get beer while drunk. She said the police are watching for him. I told my brother in law to quit driving drunk, even just a block.

The Old Roller Coaster. When I was a child I used to go to a local amusement park. The park had one of the oldest roller coasters in the USA. I went on it once and it felt shaky and unsafe. I decided I would never go on it again since I valued my safety. I recently heard that the park had finally tore it down.

Big Test. Jon has a big math test in the morning. He decided he didn't need to study. When he got to class, he felt confident. His teacher gave out the test and he started filling out answers. Jon was excited when he made an A.

Bonding Time. Joe wanted to spend some time with his dad. He decided he wanted them to build a birdhouse. His dad agreed and they started building. It took them four hours to complete the birdhouse. Joe and his dad had a wonderful time.

Adler. Mary drove past a concert featuring Megadeth. She wasn't at all a fan of heavy metal. She went to a nice quiet coffee shop, instead. The barista told her she'd just missed Chris Adler! Mary didn't know that was Megadeth's guitarist.

The Castle. Shirley had always wanted to see a castle in real life. She grew up on fairy-tales and disney movies. One day her parents surprised her with a trip to Europe. There she was able to visit different castles. She loved every minute of it.

New dog. Sean bought a new dog and walked him everywhere. As the dog was friendly, people stopped to talk to Sean. But Sean didn't like to talk to people. So in the end, he left his dog in the courtyard. And he only walked him at night when no one was around.

No Donuts. Greg was trying to stick to a diet plan. But his mom brought home a box of donuts. And he watched the rest of his family eat them. Greg decided that it wouldn't be so bad to eat one. So he enjoyed a chocolate donut with his family.

Buying another car. Heather has never owned more than one car at a time. Both her and her husband have always struggled with finances. They still struggle with finances, but just not as much as beforehand. There daughter is learning how to drive currently. They looked and were able to find another car for their family.

Wood Wins. The kids are competing to see who can break the wooden block. Nancy goes first. She takes a few seconds to think. Once she punches the wood, her middle finger broke. The doctor wrapped it with a bandage.

Snorkeling. For Spring Break Sue's dad took her to St Lucia. They rented a sailboat and sailed all around the island. One day they anchored in a cove and went snorkeling. They saw all sorts of beautiful coral and fish. As she went to sleep that night Sue could still see all bright colors.

Randy gets the girl. Randy has a crush on a girl from his school. He is very nervous about trying to ask her out. One day he decides he has to make his move. One day at Lunch he decides to sit down beside her. Randy asks her to go out with her and she replied yes!

Steve Becomes Just Like The Others. The other kids teased Steve and excluded him. He would sit on the curb, watching them play ball. One day a new kid moved onto the block. He seemed meek, and Steve loudly made fun of him. The other kids joined in, and Steve was now a part of the gang.

Frombo. Frombo Strongberg liked to fight. Every day of every week he trained in combat. One day, he lost a fight. This only encouraged Frombo to train harder and harder. It paid off when he was declared World Champion at fighting.

Responsibility. Amanda had a test coming up that she had to study for. However, there was a big concert the night before. She really wanted to go, but knew it was best not to. All of her classmates went to the concert and had a great time. The next day, Amanda was the only person to get an A on the test.

Major Regret. A man once sat down to write a story for his job. He spent hours making the greatest story he ever imagined. When he was finished he tried to save his great work. However, once he clicked the save icon the power surged. The story was lost and he could not remember what he wrote.

Deer Huntress. Betty resolved to finally make her first kill. All the boys had teased her endlessly about her gender. She was now in front of a scope with the deer in her sights. Betty could not pull the trigger as the deer looked too helpless. Betty decided to go home and take out her frustrations on her husband.

Self Esteem. The doctor told me I needed more self esteem. I knew he was right, but I didn't know how to gain it. He told me to work harder and try to be more successful in life. Without self esteem, I didn't know how to do that. I went home to digest what he had told me and formulate a plan.

Ross The Gamer. Ross was really into adventure games. His friend bought him a new shooting game on Steam. Ross played with his friend online for hours. Ross eventually became really good at the game. He was good enough to become a professional gamer.

Cherries Jubilee. I dated a legally blind person in 1979. She had very little vision due to retinitis pigmentosa. We went to a restaurant and she ordered cherries jubilee. When the waiter lit the dessert she jumped from the table. The sudden light disturbed her.
Pothole. Sam was driving home at night. He couldn't see the road too well. He hit a big pothole. It dented his tire rim. Sam had to get a new replacement for it.

New Handle. The handle on my desk broke. I decided to go to a hardware store for a replacement. The store had no properly sized handles. Instead I bought two small knobs for the handle holes. I have found they work just as well.

After School Getaway. Fran was enrolled an after school tutoring program. She would skip the program every day. A teacher spotted her running off one day. The teacher notified her mother. Fran now attends her after school program with her mother.

Candy. Abby loves to eat candy. She thought it would be nice to share her candy with friends. Abby's friends came over to her house. Abby gifted each of her friends with a bag of candy. They ate the candy together.

Chemistry Lab. The teacher gave us instructions for the lab. We started immediately after he finished. While doing the project, I was extremely confident. However, I started to slow down since the experiment became difficult. I didn't finish the experiment after the class was over.

Condo. Carol was ready to purchase a condo. The building was already confirmed. All she had to do was meet with the realtor. However, Carol checked her numbers one last time. The extreme cost made her second-guess her decision.
The Date. Jack and Jill were at dinner. It was their first date. They had a lot to talk about. They talked for five hours. Jack told Jill he wanted to go out with her again soon.

The Early Baby. Marissa was pregnant but far from her due date. She was planning on a relaxing month before she would give birth. Suddenly one day she began feeling pains. She thought it must be something else since it was so early. To her shock, it was the baby who was early but healthy.

Volcano. Ida wanted to make a volcano for her science fair project. She went online and looked up instructions. Then she carefully crafted her project. On science fair day, her volcano really erupted! Ida impressed her teachers with her great project.
Crushing Like a Frog. My family went camping in New England. I formed my first crush on a blond boy. His name was Henry. Henry and I went to the pond. He pushed me in.
Crush. The boy had a crush on a girl. He wrote her a note. She didn't respond to the note. He tried to talk to her. She turned his back to him.

Bumping into old friends. Tina went to this new restaurant yesterday. She was not that excited about it. When she got there she was saw someone she knew. Tina saw her old friend. She ended up inviting her for coffee afterwards.

The paint compromise. Elizabeth was planning on painting her living room. She and her husband disagreed on what color to paint it. She wanted a light color and he wanted darker. Finally they played rock, paper, scissors. Elizabeth won and they went with light, but slightly dark blue.
Test. Omar was doing poorly in English class. He needed to do well on his final test. He studied hard for it. On test day, he did his best. He was thrilled to find out he had scored a B!

Diet. Fiona was constantly being pressured by her mother to diet. Hardly a day went by that her mother didn't comment on her weight. She eventually pressured her into a 12 day juice cleanse. After days of the cleanse, Fiona had enough and came to a decision. It was her body, and her decision whether she dieted or not.

Annoying toy. My daughter got this toy dog for her birthday that barks all day long. It was fine at first. It didn't bother me. But one day we went on a long road trip. Let's just say the dog didn't make it back from that trip.

Harper Gets Lost. Harper was the know-it-all of his scout troop. The other boys always followed Harper's rules without question. It all changed when they went on their overnight camping trip. Harper explained he needed no compass and hiked alone without it. They found him hours later, crying and embarrassed under a tree.

Cake. Mary was baking her mom a birthday cake. She used box mix and made it very rich. Then she decorated with lots of frosting. She even filled it with jam. Mary's mom said it was the best cake ever!

Back Breaker. My family from New York arrived in front of our house. I helped them unpack their belongings into my house. While I picked up a suitcase, Ben jumped on my back. He ended up spraining my spine. I had to rest flat on my bed until a doctor came.

Dog Bath. Tim gave his dog a bath today because he got dirty in the yard. The dog stood in the tub while he ran water over him. He then dribbled shampoo on the dog and began to suds him up. He rinsed him off and let him shake in the tub a few times. Finally, to dry him off, he took him for a walk in the sun.

The Soup. Sam wanted to make this one white bean soup really bad. The problem was that he didn't have all the ingredients. After looking in his fridge he found some good ones. He put all the ingredients he thought would work instead. After hours of cooking the soup it came out amazing.

A Movie. Alana had written several best-selling fantasy novels. She was approached by a company who wanted to make a movie of them. She was so excited she could barely contain it. It took a long time, but finally the movie was released. Seeing her stories come to life was a dream come true for Alana.

The Lunchtime Pizza. Mary left her packed lunch on the counter. There was a meeting at 1 PM. The manager ordered pizza for the entire group. Mary had a slice of supreme pizza as she prepared for her meeting. Mary was no longer hungry, and didn't eat her packed lunch.

Hooray for Lisa. Lisa wanted to be a teacher. She studied very hard for four years to get her degree. She did her state required shadowing. She did her student teaching. Finally, the state gave Lisa her teaching certificate!

Hoop. Megan took out her hula hoop and began to hoop. She kept the hoop going around for a long time. This made Megan very tired. She put the hoop down and took a rest. After a while she started hooping once again.

Acid rainy. Neil was doing a science report. He decided he would write it on the topic of acid rainy. He researched acid rainy and wrote a great paper. He even added a video about the effects of acid rainy. Neil's teachers and classmates loved his great presentation!
Go to the Store. I woke up craving cookies. There were no cookies in the house. I went to the store to purchase cookies. I drove home with my purchase. I ate cookies for breakfast.

Crafting a Business. Lacie decide to try to make a candle. She researched the proper technique online. She ordered the necessary supplies. She worked very hard making the candle perfect. Lacie loved her candle so much she started a candle business!

Costume Contest. Tim entered his school's annual costume contest. He sewed his own costume by hand. All the contestants had great costumes, and he worried. He doubted he'd even get an honorable mention. But to Tim's shock and joy, he won third place in the contest!
Silverfish. I was using the toilet. Suddenly, I saw a silverfish. I got scared. I picked up a magazine and killed it. Finally, I could use the toilet in peace.

Renee goes Camping. Renee had a strong love for camping One day she went camping with her friends Her and her friends set up the tents, and made a fire They roasted hot dogs and Marshmallows over the fire They had a very good time and barely slept

The Chairs. The executive was hosting a meeting. He brought in twenty chairs for his visitors. When they arrived, they sat down at the table. The chairs all broke and the guests fell on the floor. The exec was humiliated!

Bus still waiting. Allie always got up late in the morning. One day she was very late in waking up. But the school bus beeped and still waited. Allie was embarrassed that that happened. But her bus driver was nice and did not mind.

Picking Flowers. One day Tonya went out to the garden to pick flowers. She found some sunflowers. She picked mainly them. When she was done she put them in a vase in her bedroom. She loved how they looked.

Big Fishing Trip. Me and Travis went fishing on a huge lake. We caught a thirteen inch trout. We caught a ten inch salmon. We caught a two foot bass. We put all the fish into a bucket and took them home.
peanut scare. Jimmy is allergic to nuts. He took a big bite out of a candy bar. He swallowed it. He realized he just ate peanuts. Jimmy was rushed to the hospital for help.
Winter coat. The weather was starting to turn cold. Josh did not have a coat. He decided to go shopping. He found the perfect coat. He bought it and was glad he found a warm coat.

Inheritance. Jo's grandmother died, and let her an inheritance. Jo went to the lawyer's office to collect the items. She was surprised to see hundreds of cardboard boxes. Jo's grandmother had left her a library! Jo spent months sorting through the books.

Driving at Night. John hated driving at night. The other car's headlights seemed so bright! The car had been tailgating him, and finally passed him. He was amazed to see that only one headlight was operating! He was still glad that it was not behind him any longer.

Judy's pastry. Judy was a baker. Her favourite thing to make was puff pastry. Every time she made a new batch, they sold out very quickly. Once, a local foodie tried her puff pastry. He said it was the best he'd ever had.

Annual Trip. The Anderson family wanted to take a big vacation. They saved up their money all year. At the end of the year they booked a trip to Mexico. The Anderson's had so much fun while on vacation. They decided to take a family trip on an annual basis.

Kimmy's Cookies. Kimmy wanted to make cookies. She put all the needed ingredients on the table. She dropped an egg when mixing the batter. She got another one out of the refrigerator. The cookies turned out delicious.

Xerxes's Xenophobic Xeroxes. Xerxes was raised in a very sheltered monotonous community. He had not be exposed to many other cultures. He had trouble realizing when he was doing something impolite. He was making copies for a flyer for a garage sale. He didn't realize that he had used xenophobic terms on the flyer.

Bhishma. My friend Dave's father was into Indian religion. He set up a commune in upstate New York. His daughter married a man who renamed himself Bhishma. A few years later he left the commune and took back his name, Dave. I had read about Bhishma in the Mahabharata and was amused.
History Test. Andrew hadn't studied for his history test. He took history after lunch. Andrew pretended to be sick around lunchtime. He went home. Andrew wasn't at school to take the test.

My Cat Fluffy. My cat Fluffy is very sneaky. She hides under the furniture when people aren't paying attention. Fluffy hid under the sofa to jump out at me. It turned out to be the dog instead of me. Fluffy was shocked when she got a bite from the dog!
The Joke. Last week Lance told a hilarious joke. None of us expected it. Jimbo laughed so hard milk came out of his nose. That made everyone laugh even more. Which made more milk come out.
Doing a good favor. Allie had elderly neighbors. She decided to help them. She mowed their lawn for them. The neighbor's were grateful. She did not even charge them.

Gerald. Gerald loved Ali and wanted to marry her. He was hesitant to ask her. He thought for sure she would refuse him. Finally, he built up his courage and proposed. And to his shock and joy, she accepted!

The First Grade. Twas the night before the first day of school and Jaila was excited. She helped her mom pick out her clothes for the next day. After she ate dinner she packed her backpack with all her new supplies. When it was time for bed Jaila had trouble falling asleep. The next morning she woke up ate breakfast and ran to the bus stop.

Too many shampoos. Jasmine went to Winco to buy some tampons. In that aisle, there were two older Vietnamese men looking at shampoo. Jasmine felt uncomfortable reaching past them for a box of tampons. The two Vietnamese men did not flinch but watched her make a decision. When she turned around they asked her what the word shampoo meant.

The flat tire. Amy was driving to work one day. Out of the blue her tire went flat. She pulled over and call triple A for assistance. The repairman arrived and changed the tire. Amy happily thanked the repair man, and drove to work.

Free. Before travelling, I need to buy new clothes to fit the weather. I didn't have much nor did I have much money. One day I was at a friend's house and she started to get rid of things. She made a huge stack of clothes she didn't want. She gave them to me and I didn't have to buy anything!
Precious. The girl was very sweet. She loved everyone she met. She ran to me and hugged me tight. Her hair smelled like strawberries. I hugged her back happily.
silence. Anna was participating in a day of silence. She started out struggling. She really wanted to speak! But by midafternoon it was easier. Anna was able to be silent all day.

Locked out. One day I was being really impatient with myself. I was taking a long time to leave the house and I was finally fed up. I walked swiftly out of my apartment door and slammed it. I then realized that I forgot my keys in my frustration. Humiliated I had to ask my landlord for the spare keys.

home ec. Katie was making a casserole in home ec class. She had assembled all her ingredients carefully. She tried hard because the meal was half her final grade. But poor Katie's casserole was tasteless and burned! Her final grade went down to a "C".

A mix up. Karol was ready to start the school year. She had bought notebooks, pens, and binders. On the first day of class, she was sure she would be prepared. She opened her backpack in the morning. She had taken her brothers things to school.

One day of Starvation. Kenny received his braces today. The orthodontist advised him not to eat any solid foods. Kenny decided to drink smoothies for the entire day. However, he felt hungry for the whole day. He passed out when he came home since he was starving.

Getting Fired. Tom was called into his boss's office. He was being fired for something he didn't do. Tom explained that it was a different employees fault. His boss didn't seem to listen. Tom was forced to vacate immediately.

Bye Dad. It was the middle of the night when we received the news. We needed to go to the hospital because of my dad's critical condition. On the rushed two hour journey I was talking with God. I was telling him that if my dad died, I would understand. We finally arrived to learn that he died minutes before our arrival.

Sign Me Up. I thought astrology was phoney baloney. Tina taught me otherwise. She said Sagittarius would be the love of my life. I met Hunky Howard who was born on the Sagittarius cusp. Now I believe in cosmic science called astrology.

The Cow. The farmer wanted to add a large animal. He bought a cow. THe cow ate all the grass and then scared the chickens. The farmer was beginning to doubt this plan. Then his children fell in love with the giant creature.

Sick. Travis saw a homeless man on the sidewalk. And he decided to give the man money. The homeless man coughed and sneezed during the exchange. And Travis felt sick after he got home. He felt regretful about approaching the homeless man.

The Trapeze. Gina had always wanted to be in the circus. The trapeze was her real goal. One day, she saw an ad for trapeze lessons! She signed up and couldn't wait for class to begin. She had waited her whole life for this!

From Girlfriend To Landlord. Brandon's girlfriend was more generous when they broke up. Brandon and Tina lived together and they wanted to separate. But Brandon didn't have anyplace to move into. Tina bought another house and now Brandon pays her rent. Now she is his landlord and even accepts late rent payments.

Santa Claus. Andrew loved Christmas. He use to love when his father would dress up as Santa. So Andrew wanted to dress up as Santa for his kid. He came into the house during Christmas eve dressed as Santa. His son's eyes lit up and Andrew was glad.
New Car. Jerry got a new car. He took it for a long drive. He was having a lot of fun. A cop pulled him over for speeding. Now Jerry drives more carefully.

New Boss. My niece's new boss started this week. He is a manager from another state division. He started showing up at 7 Am, 1/2 an hour before starting. He asked his staff to do the same. They filed a union grievance.

Computer Programming. My cousin wants to be a computer programmer. He started going to college for it. After a few semesters he dropped out. He found out it was boring and uninspiring. Now he doesn't do anything.
Bubble Bubble. Cora wanted to blow a bubble with her gum. She chewed and blew. Her brother came and explained how to do it. Cora tried one more time. She blew a huge gum bubble.
Soft Serve. The man ordered an ice cream cone. He didn't realize that it was soft serve. He was disappointed when the waiter brought it. He ate it anyways. It had a disappointing texture.
grades. There was a little boy who didn't have any exams yet. His first one he was really nervous. The teacher assured him it would be okay. He did his best. The teacher gave him a passing grade.

Smart Move. Jeff bought a foreclosed house for a cheap price. He fixed it up and put it up for rent. He found renters to signed a five year lease. Every month Jeff makes a profit from the renters. Jeff puts all his profits into his savings for his retirement.

Son. His son was a good boy, he had brown curly hair and kind eyes. He always wanted the best for everyone and helped whenever he could. One day, his father was killed in a battle. The boy packed up his things and left. He was never the same kind, innocent boy again.

Grass. Shirley hated the grass a lot. She didn't like how it felt on her feet. One day, she decided to go outside. Suddenly, Shirley was forced to step on some grass. After that, Shirley enjoyed walking on grass every day.

Lace Looks Good On Everyone, Darling. Samson loved to watch his favorite celebrity's performances. At one live stage concert, his idol came out wearing a stunning dress. Their gorgeous look inspired Samson to want to look like that too! He met the performer after the show and confessed his admiration. He was overjoyed when his icon gave him the dress to wear himself!

Carlos Weeds His Garden. Carlos notices that many weeds have grown in his flower garden. He decides to spend Saturday morning weeding the garden. While weeding, Carlos notices that his jeans get a little dirty. After he is finished, he puts his jeans in the washing machine. He decides having a weeded garden is worth having to wash his jeans.
New fast food. Allie was hungry. She decided to get some fast food. She went to the new one. Allie ordered a burger. She ate it in ten minutes.

Accident. I was driving in my hybrid car near my house. My neighbor's son was riding his bicycle along the same road. Suddenly, he swerved his bicycle in front of my car. I could not hit the brakes in time and hit him. The coroner said that he had died on impact.

Dream. I dreamed I found a giant turtle in the back yard. It was large and obviously very old. The shell was turning a whitish grey color. I picked it up to make sure it wasn't a snapping turtle. I showed it to my family and we decided to keep it.

Building a dock. John and Dave set out to build a dock. They wanted to build the dock so their kids to fish off of it. They started by cutting down some local trees. They planked the wood and fastened everything in place. After several long days the dock was complete.

Painted Lines. A construction worker was assigned to paint lines in the parking lot. He started off normal but felt like being artistic. He drew a beautiful pattern that was very unlike a parking lot. He even signed his name at the bottom corner of the lot. People walked by and thought he was a performance artist.
Clothes. Cindy had a date tonight. She did not know what to wear. She looked in her closet for hours. She tried on clothes for a long time. Cindy's date arrived but had to wait for her to be ready.

Too Tired For Work. The baker was tired this morning. He had to open up shop at 5 AM. He chugged a cup of coffee. The baker still fell asleep while on his job. He was so tired that he had to take the rest of the day off.

Signs of Spring. Ben woke up to the sound of birds chirping. The snow had melted and the sun was shining very brightly. He opened the door and decided he didn't need his coat. Ben noticed some green leaves and grass on his way to work. Writing the date at work, Ben realized it was the first day of Spring.
Losing Weight. Kara was on a diet. She had lost a lot of weight. Kara's waist was getting smaller. Her clothes weren't fitting anymore. Kara had to buy new clothes.

Comics. Charles wanted to write comic strips with a nice message. Charles set to work sketching characters and stories. Charles' characters were beloved almost immediately. Charles used his characters to promote kindness and goodwill. Charles was very happy with his lot in life.
Plums. Nelson can't eat plums. He makes a horrible mess with the juice. It gets all over his face, clothes, and hands. Then, he's sticky and purple. That's why he took a banana from the fruit bowl.

Funny Face. Frank had to go to the dentist to have a tooth pulled. Frank had his friend Grace accompany him, so that she could drive. Frank was given anesthesia so that the procedure could begin. After the procedure, Frank had a very funny face. Grace could not stop laughing at the face Frank was making.

Tooth pain. Carlos had one bad tooth. It hurt him every time he ate something. Because he was so stubborn, he refused to go to the dentist. But when the pain became unbearable he had to go. The dentist removed the tooth and Carlos could eat normally again.

Too Tall. William was a tall man waiting in line to his seat in an airplane. He was afraid the seat might be too small for him. To his surprise the seat was quite roomy. William sighed with relief. It was going to be a comfortable flight after all.

Not on your Side Today. The game was tied at 89 with 30 seconds to go. Tim ran as soon as he can to score a basket. When he tried to make a tear drop shot, it slightly missed. I was able to catch the rebound and make a transition basket. Our team ended up winning the game.

Zoo trip. I took my son to the zoo. He likes to see the Giraffe's. I thought it would be fun for him to feed a Giraffe. He approached the Giraffe with food in his hand. The Giraffe stuck out his gross tongue and my son screamed!

quick trip to the store. I remembered that I forgot to get mouthwash. I walked across the street to the store. I picked out the flavor of mouthwash that I wanted. I took the mouthwash to the cash register and paid for it. I walked back home with my purchase.

The Baby Shower. Cody was pregnant, so her friends decided to give her a baby shower. Cody had so many people come to the shower that she was overwhelmed. They played lots of games and ate lots of food. There were more presents there than anyone had ever seen. The baby shower was very successful!

Crust. Abe made some Mac N Cheese for supper. It was delicious and he ate it all. Abe let the bowl sit on his desk for too long. The cheese turned into a hard yellow crust. Abe had a difficult time scrubbing it off!

Rich Family. Pam asked Drew if she can hang out with him. When drew said yes, she invited him to her house. When drew looked inside, he saw luxurious items on the table. A butler appeared and asked if they wanted anything. Pam told him no and took Drew to her 2 acre backyard.
Cheating. Josh was in high school. He always made perfect grades. One day he forgot about a quiz. He decided to cheat and got caught. Josh's parents were called and he was punished.

Birthday. Tom was a 16 year old high school student. Toms birthday was coming up and he was excited. His parents got him many presents. He opened each one enthusiastically. He received many great presents and was very grateful.

Store. We lived above a candy store in Chinatown in 1960. One day the owner died and the store was abandoned. A kid climbed into the window and opened the door. The kids took all the candy. The store was boarded up later, and never reopened.

Cavities. Matthew was scared of going to the dentist. When he finally went, the dentist found 3 cavities. The dentist told him he would have to come back to get them filled. He was very anxious while he waited for his next appointment. He vowed to do a better job of looking after his teeth in the future.

Walking in the rain. My car wouldn't start so I walked to work in the rain. My feet got soaked because there's holes in my shoes. When I got to work, I tracked mud all over the carpet. I spent most of the day cleaning up the mess I had made. On the walk home I bought new shoes and called my mechanic.

Best Christmas. Allen was sad on Christmas. He wanted to buy his girlfriend a new phone. He didn't have enough money so he went to buy her flowers. On the way to the florist he found a $100 bill. He picked it up and bought his girlfriend a new phone.
Karen. Karen was a mom of two. She loved her children. Karen took them to Disneyland. They all were so excited. They went to Disneyland and rode all the rides.

Fued. Dan and his family were watching football. Dan bet his brother the Giants would beat the Vikings. They bet the loser would clean up after the party. It was Dan's house but he didn't want to have to clean up. Dan mocked his brother for an hour as his brother cleaned up.

The Tie Choice. The President of the United States couldn't decide what tie to wear. He usually chose between a red or a blue tie. Today he decided to change it up with a piano tie. His wife told him to wear a blue tie but he refused. Many people laughed at his tie choice when he wore it in public.

Cracked Screen. Kelly dropped her phone while texting one day. She was scared that it was broken beyond repair! She quickly picked it up and examined it. The screen was shattered, but the rest appeared to work. Kelly decided that, all in all, she had been lucky.
The Chalk. The kids liked to play in the driveway. They drew often with chalk. One day, they made a giant masterpiece. They worked for hours on it. Then the rain started and ruined it all!

The School Year. Beth was so excited! School was starting again. She had a great teacher and a lot of friends in her class. She packed her backpack and gathered her supplies. She walked into the school building with a lot of excitement.

The Missing Keys. Jonathan does not get along with his co-worker, Ryan. Yesterday, Jonathan set his keys on his desk when he got to work. As a joke, Ryan took Jonathan's keys and hid them. Jonathan confronted Ryan about the missing keys. Jonathan found the keys behind the microwave in the break room.

The Last Towel. Chad was on his way to the beach. On the way he realized he forgot to pack a towel. He stopped at the first store he saw. The store only had one beach towel left in its stock. He got it and was relieved he had something to sit on at the beach.

Circus. Sherrill wanted to take her husband to the circus. Her husband considered it low-brow entertainment. They compromised on seeing a cirque du soleil show. Sherrill got her circus and her husband got his high-brow show. They both felt that it was the right choice, in retrospect.

The Music Lover. Lindsay loves music, especially concerts. She worked a boring job, but it paid for concert tickets. One day, Lindsay saw there was a job opening at a radio station. She didn't have experience, but she emphasized her love of music. Lindsay got the job and is now paid to watch concerts!

Old Dog. Lucy has a dog named Daisy. Daisy is eleven years old and is getting weak. Daisy has a hard time walking and getting up the stairs. Lucy goes to the vet and gets medicine for Daisy. The medicine makes Daisy stronger for the time being.

Ice Cream Truck. The sound of an ice cream truck became more loud. I decided to run outside and look for the truck. It was moving on the left side of the street. When the truck arrived, I walked to the front. The driver offered several flavors to buy.

Skating Lessons. I took ice skating lessons as a child but never learned. I still wanted to take lessons when I became an adult. The local rink offered skating lessons so I enrolled. I went to class every week and practiced as well. I learned how to skate.

Gambler. Roger was a gambler. He knew he was addicted, but he couldn't quit. Even when he married, his wife couldn't make him stop. But then, a year later, she gave him a beautiful baby son. Roger saw his son's tiny face - and he never gambled again.
The Jail. Mary was in big trouble. She had robbed a gas station. She got put in jail. She sat there for days until she was bailed out. Mary had to report to the courthouse for her trial.

Talk. I was on the bench with my 99 year old friend Jim yesterday. His 78 year old neighbor George joined ua. Jim went up for lunch. George and I marveled about Jim's long life. We said we hope to grow as old as Jim.
bag. The man found a bag on the ground. He looked inside. It was groceries. He brought them home. He made his wife dinner with them.

Starbucks Wi-Fi. I was living in my car and needed internet. I decided to go to Starbucks, because they have free Wi-Fi. I got there, ordered some coffee, and set up my computer. I connected to the Wi-Fi and logged in. The internet was so slow I couldn't even do anything.

Doll Show. In 2005 my wife wanted to go to a doll show. It was in Whitman, 20 miles away from Boston. I drove her there and waited in the eating area. A stranger said I was a good husband. My wife was pleased to go to the store.

Personal Dignity. Lea dreaded working with Dan because he was sexually harassing her. He stared at her, stood too close, and made personal comments. She tried to ignore it, but one day he went too far, grabbing her. She was angry and embarrassed in front of her coworkers. Demanding to be left alone, Lea finally filed a complaint with HR.

Boredom Sets In. When Phil left his position as head pastor he was relieved. He had been trying to work a full time job and pastor a church too. It was a huge responsibility and he was just worn out. He moved his family across the country to escape. Now he is bored because he has too much free time on his hands.

Push on the Swings. Amy was sitting on a swing at Lynn's house. Amy wasn't swinging, she was just sitting there talking. Lynn asked for a push. Amy pushed Lynn on the swing for awhile, then she stopped. She realized at 14, they were getting too old for swing sets.

Fixing my car. One day my car was making strange noises. I opened up the hood to investigate. I couldn't find the source of the problem. I took it to a mechanic. After a few hours and a large bill, the car was fixed.
Yancy. Yancy worked in a coal mine. One morning the mine collapsed. Yancy gathered his fellow miners together. They started digging a hole. With Yancy's lead, they were free by the end of the day.
Broken mug. Melli was drinking some coffee. All the sudden her mug dropped. She was furious. She could not believe that happened. She had to buy a new one.

Doing laundry. Jen had several loads of laundry to do. She put a load of dark clothes in the washing machine. She started the washer and went to do some other chores. Halfway through the cycle the washer started leaking. Jen had to stop the washer and clean up the mess.

Car wash. Scott needed a job. After submitting many applications, he did not get called back. Determined, Scott started offering to wash his neighbors cars for pay. Some of Scott's neighbors took him up on his offer. Now Scott has a regular clientele and a thriving business.

Henry Bear's Park. Henry Bear's Park is a toy store in Cambridge. It sells non violent toys. One day it offered a toy coupon for toy gun exchange. My 8 year old son traded in his guns. He brought in two huge garbage bags full of toy guns.

Chloe gets a haircut. Chloe was starting school on Friday. She realized she was overdue for a haircut. Her mother drove her across town to the stylist. The stylist cut Chloe's hair exactly the way she wanted it. Chloe was happy to go to school sporting her new do.

The Movies. Jim wants to see an action movie but Jen wants to see a romantic one. They flip a coin to see which one to go to and Jim won the coin toss. Jim could still see that Jen was a little upset. He offered that they go see the romantic movie that night. Jen was so happy that she went to see Jim's movie the next night.

So What's With Coffee Anyway?. Jay watched his dad have coffee every morning. He begged to have a cup of his own. Finally his dad gave in. Jay took a big gulp. He wondered how his dad could drink that horrible stuff.

Faded Jeans. Beth wore her favorite faded jeans to school. All her friends loved them. The principal saw them on Beth and pulled her aside. He told her they were not appropriate for school. Beth had to go home and change.

The Ice Cream. The kids were hungry and hot. Their mom said she would buy them ice cream. They got to pick out whatever flavor they wanted. They settled on chocolate and strawberry. It was a delicious treat and cooled them off!

Nap Mistake. I had a bus ticket for later in the day at 5:30pm. I was sleepy, so I decided to take a nap. However, unbeknownst to me, I had set my alarm for the wrong time. When I woke up it was already 6:00. I had to catch the next bus early the following morning.
Piano. A mother told her son to practice piano. He practiced everyday to get better. He got ready for his recital. He practiced his new songs. The recital went really well for him.

Lucky Penny. Jody went to see a fortune teller. Jody sat at a table with a crystal ball on it. The fortune teller told Jody that she would come into some money. Jody laughed because she didn't believe her. Outside Jody laughed again because she found a penny on the sidewalk.

The Speakers. Julio cranked the volume up. He had installed huge new speakers in his media room. The music blasted and he danced around. He was thrilled with his new addition. He started planning for installing some special lights, too.

The Garden. Jeff decided that he wanted to start a garden. He went to a store and bought seeds and garden tools. Once he was home, he got straight to work. He tilled the dirt and planted the seeds. Jeff put his tools away and smiled at his work.

The Friend Fight. Jordan and Sara were playing at the pool. They were fighting over who got to play with the mermaid doll. Jordan was so mad about the doll that she decided to leave. Sara was mad that her friend left her alone at the pool. Both girls refused to speak to each other for weeks.

Sleepy Cat. My cat is brown, white and orange. She likes to sleep on a red fuzzy blanket. When she lays on the blanket she immediately begins to purr. Sometimes I pick her up from the blanket and hold her. If she's sleepy she'll fall asleep in my arms.

bottles. Anna wanted to clean up her neighborhood. She took a big bag. Then she set off to pick up all the discarded cans and bottles. Anna made a big difference. And she earned a lot of money by turning in the bottles!

Bananas. Barry's mom told him to go to the grocery store. He headed out soon afterward. In the store, he realized he hadn't asked what to buy. He decided just to grab some bananas and head home. When he returned, his mother was thankful.

Mother's Day Cruise. Rita wanted to do something special for her mom. It was mother's day this weekend. Rita booked for them in Florida. Rita and her mother enjoyed themselves on the cruise. Afterwards, her mother thanked Rita for being so thoughtful.

Regrets. There was a girl in my class that everyone made fun of. She never fought back, rather she just looked at the ground. One day I saw her by the fence sobbing uncontrollably. I felt like something bad was going to happen, but walked away. The next morning I heard the news talking about a young girl's suicide.

Tight Shoes. Jennie went to the mall to find some new shoes. She saw that her favorite shoe store was having a sale. She bought three pairs of shoes that she liked. She tried on the shoes once she got home. She didn't like the way any of them fit.

Christmas time. Last Christmas was amazing. I visited my family in Philadelphia. While I was there we sang a lot of carols and ate a lot of chocolate. On Christmas day we opened all our presents. I got so many Christmas gifts!

Beads, Beads, Everywhere. Katherine came home from a trip to the grocery store. Her dog was waiting anxiously by the door. When she entered the house, the dog started jumping up and down. The dog's paw got caught in Katherine's beaded bracelet. The bracelet broke and beads rolled all over the floor.
Pizza. Ashley wanted some pizza. She went to the store. She bought some Daiya brand pizza. Going back home, it started to rainy. Her car slid from the rainy and she died in the crash.
Good Spot. Milly took a map on her walk. She found a spot to visit. She followed the map to the spot. She ate a nice snack when she reached the spot. She marked the spot on her map to remember.

Cartoons. At 7 Year's old Eli didn't like cartoons. He would rather watch Law and Order. He liked murder not talking animals. So he would watch crime shows all day. Eli was a sociopath and killed his family at twelve.

My New Puppy. I go to the animal shelter every day to meet the new puppies. Yesterday I met Jumpy. I knew he was the perfect puppy for my family. When I took him home he wagged his tail and played with my sisters. We are all happy that Jumpy is part of our family.
Tennis. Kate loved playing tennis. She was not very great at it. She finally decided to take lessons. She was able to learn some new tricks. Kate was able to improve her skills.

Movie. Harry and his friends went to see a scary movie. They were scared and jumped in their seats at a few points. After the movie, they played some video games in the lobby. They got some more candy at the counter. They drove home.

Grumpy. Albert was a shut in who didn't like people. One day, a little girl crossed his lawn and he yelled at her. The girl was not afraid and approached Albert with a nice red rose. He took the rose silently and nodded. Now, he always likes when the little girl crosses his lawn.

Age Difference. Amy was 14 turning 15 in 3 months. Her boyfriend, Ben turned 15 4 months ago. They were in the same grade at different schools. But her parents didn't like that he was older than her. So Amy had to sneak and see him without them knowing.

What to do. Mark wanted to have some fun this weekend. He made a list of what he wanted to do. On the list was going to the movies or taking a hike. Mark made a list of pros and cons to each activity. He decided to take a hike because of his health.

Summer Job. Connor needed a summer job. He looked in the newspaper for job ads. He applied to several different jobs. Connor only heard back from one job that he applied for. He is now working as a camp counselor.

Mints. Ki was training her horse to do tricks. At first she had a hard time getting him to listen. Then she began to reward him with mints. Ki's horse loved mints! Soon she was able to train him to do a dozen tricks - for mints!
Bad ice cream. Susie got some bad ice cream. It looked good at first. Then it melted. Susie was not pleased. She didn't want it anymore.
